result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randal H. Schmidt

defendant.name: Schmidt, Randal H.
defendant.address: C/o Waushara County Jail 430 E. Division Street, Wautoma, WI 54982

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:34 pm cases called.  15CM306 & 15CM427-Defendant Randal H. Schmidt in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 & 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads in Count 3 & 15CM427. Court dismisses and reads-in any possible uncharged bail jumping charges in violation of bond in either case up to the present. Statement by Court sentences the defendant to EACH COUNT: 9 months WCJ Imposed and STAYED and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years. Concurrent to each other. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 1 day served. CONDITIONS: DAAP and follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. AODA and follow through, No Contact with D. Schmidt unless which may be authorized through the family court order. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

Transcripts of Proceedings:

Bail/Bond Hearing - September 2, 2015
Status Conference - November 17, 2015

NOT PUT OF RECORD-Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons.

15CM-306 and 15CM-427 - Both Cases Called @ 2:41 PM: Defendant Randal H. Schmidt in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CM-427:   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.   Per SPD:  Def remains in custody in Waupaca Co awaiting SEHR.  Requests that Waupaca Co be resolved prior to Waushara Cases.  ADA would not object to further STC being scheduled.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  ADA argues for Signature Bond w/conditions.  SPD argues as to bond request.  Victim is present in the courtroom and requests to address bond request.  Contact requested by victim.  The Court:  Respectfully declines bond modification as to contact due to pending case and conduct alleged.  STC scheduled.  Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 09:20 am.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum
records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus
